command-line: python run.py CYTOMINE_HOST CYTOMINE_PUBLIC_KEY CYTOMINE_PRIVATE_KEY CYTOMINE_ID_PROJECT CYTOMINE_ID_SOFTWARE CYTOMINE_ID_JOB CYTOMINE_ID_USERS CYTOMINE_ID_IMAGES CYTOMINE_ID_TERMS CYTOMINE_REVIEWED CYTOMINE_DOWNLOAD_ALPHA CYTOMINE_ZOOM_LEVEL N_JOBS CYTOMINE_ID_TERM_POSITIVE CYTOMINE_ID_TERM_NEGATIVE

inputs.name: Training job id
inputs.description: Identifier of the training job. The job should have the trained model attached (as a "model.joblib" attached file) and the properties 'binary', 'classes' and 'positive_classes'.

inputs.name: Cytomine users ids
inputs.description: (Annotations filtering) Identifiers of users of which the annotations should be selected for prediction.

inputs.name: Cytomine images ids
inputs.description: (Annotations filtering) Identifiers of images of which the annotations should be selected for prediction.

inputs.name: Cytomine terms ids
inputs.description: (Annotations filtering) Identifiers of terms of which the annotations should be selected for prediction.

inputs.name: Cytomine reviewed
inputs.description: (Annotations filtering) Whether (true) or not (false) to include the reviewed annotations in training data.

inputs.name: Download alpha channel
inputs.description: Whether (true) or not (false) to download the alpha channel with the crops

inputs.name: Zoom level
inputs.description: Zoom level at which the crops should be downloaded

inputs.name: Positive term id
inputs.description: If the classification problem was binarized at training, the classifier will produce binary predictions. This is the identifier of the term that should be associated with the positive predictions.

inputs.name: Negative term id
inputs.description: If the classification problem was binarized at training, the classifier will produce binary predictions. This is the identifier of the term that should be associated with the negative predictions.

name: Classify-ML-RandomSubwET-Pred-BI
description: A Cytomine software for classifying crops with Random subwindows and ExtraTrees (prediction). All images are downloaded to the '/data' folder.
